macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Supreme Court Opens Door to Tariff Revisiting, Creating Market Uncertainty
items.summary: The US Supreme Court's decision has opened the possibility of revisiting tariffs, creating uncertainty as markets await further details. The limited market reaction on Friday suggests investors are apprehensive about next steps.

items.title: Canadian Dollar Marks Weekly Losses Amid Tariff Assessment
items.summary: The Canadian dollar (loonie) experienced weekly losses as investors assessed the implications of the US Supreme Court's tariff decision, with most Canadian exports already exempt from certain tariff measures.

items.title: US Stock Market Underperformance in Local Currency Terms Since Election
items.summary: While the S&P 500 is up 16% since the election, it has underperformed most other major global indices in local currency terms, with only France's CAC40 performing worse.

items.title: Dow Jones Closes Slightly Down on Friday
items.summary: The US Wall Street 30 (Dow Jones) declined 0.13% on February 20, closing at 49,348.00 USD, with a weekly loss of 0.24%.

items.title: Oil Markets Rally on Tariff Uncertainty
items.summary: Brent crude gained 5.3% for the week while West Texas Intermediate rose 5.2%, as markets await clarity on Trump's tariff policies.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Consolidates Near $68K Amid Extreme Fear and Institutional Accumulation
items.summary: Bitcoin trades around $68,000 with a Fear & Greed Index of 8, showing retail panic but whale accumulation and coins leaving exchanges. The market awaits a breakout from a symmetrical triangle pattern above $68.5K or below $65.5K.

items.title: SEC Allows Stablecoins in Broker-Dealer Capital with 2% Haircut
items.summary: The SEC updated rules to include stablecoins like USDC and USDT in regulatory capital calculations with a 2% haircut, boosting institutional DeFi access. This enhances participation in crypto markets.

items.title: CFTC Signals Imminent US Crypto Market Structure Legislation
items.summary: CFTC Chairman stated a new U.S. crypto market structure bill is close to becoming law, promising regulatory clarity and stability for digital assets.

items.title: Ethereum Trades at $1,950 Amid Extreme Fear and ETF Outflows
items.summary: Ethereum is priced between $1,950–$1,967, down 60% from its 2025 peak, with Fear & Greed at 8 and $130M ETF outflows. Ethereum Foundation unveiled a 2026 roadmap, and BlackRock ETF filing rumors emerge.

items.title: Russian Central Bank Permits Foreign Crypto Exchanges via Subsidiaries
items.summary: Russia's new regulatory bill allows foreign crypto exchanges to operate locally through subsidiaries, classifying digital currencies as 'monetary value' but banning payment use.

items.title: Bitcoin Rebounds 1.7% to $67,951 but Down Weekly
items.summary: Bitcoin rises to $67,951 amid subdued volume, down 1.2% weekly and 26% monthly. Altcoins like Cardano (+4.9%) and Solana (+2.9%) show gains.

items.title: $300 Million USDC Transfer Between Unknown Wallets
items.summary: A large $300 million USDC transfer occurred between two unknown wallets, signaling significant capital movements in the crypto ecosystem.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Georgia Tech Researchers Unveil VillainNet: AI Backdoor Attack Threatens Self-Driving Cars
items.summary: Researchers discovered a 'VillainNet' vulnerability in AI super networks for autonomous vehicles, allowing attackers to hijack systems with 99% success rate by targeting a single subnetwork. The attack remains dormant until activated and is extremely hard to detect, requiring 66x more computing power.

items.title: Yann LeCun Highlights LLM Limitations at India AI Impact Summit 2026
items.summary: AI pioneer Yann LeCun stated that while large language models excel in exams like Maths Olympiads and bar tests, they fail at real-world tasks like self-driving that humans master quickly, revealing a fundamental gap in current AI.

items.title: Tech Giants Plan $650 Billion AI Spending in 2026 Amid Stock Selloffs and Skepticism
items.summary: Google, Amazon, Meta, and Microsoft are set to spend $650 billion on AI in 2026, up from $360 billion in 2025, but recent stock drops exceeding $1 trillion reflect doubts on returns from generative AI investments.

items.title: Edge AI in Smart Grids Market Projected to Reach $19.46 Billion in 2026
items.summary: The edge AI market for smart grids is expected to grow 25.7% to $19.46 billion in 2026, driven by renewable energy integration, smart meters, and predictive analytics for energy efficiency.

items.title: Major Companies Accelerate AI-Driven Job Cuts in 2026
items.summary: Amazon lays off 16,000 employees in 2026 to streamline operations with AI, following trends at Klarna (700 FTE equivalent), UPS (20,000 jobs), and Duolingo (10% contractors replaced by AI for translations).

items.title: Emerging AI Trends Reshape HR Operations with Automation
items.summary: New AI developments in human resources focus on software automation for tasks like content creation, performance reviews, and hiring, transforming HR efficiency as highlighted in recent analysis.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Stop Killing Games Launches NGOs in US and EU for Game Preservation
items.summary: Ross Scott of Stop Killing Games announced the launch of two new NGOs in the US and EU to advocate for game preservation laws to lawmakers and conduct watchdog actions on the games industry.

items.title: Remnant Update Colossus Upgrades Guide and Fixes in Satisfactory
items.summary: Players detail challenges unlocking Colossus upgrades in the Remnant update for Satisfactory, including expedition requirements, waste disposal milestones, and corrections to Destructoid's guide on furnace chassis and widescreen cab unlocks.

items.title: Indonesia Leads Gaming Industry Growth with Government Regulations
items.summary: Indonesia's gaming sector, now serving 192.1 million gamers with $2.5 billion revenue, is boosted by 2024 regulations promoting local content, cultural storytelling, and responsible industry practices amid global market projections over $500 billion by 2030.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: US Supreme Court Strikes Down IEEPA Tariffs, Creating New Uncertainty
items.summary: The US Supreme Court ruled against IEEPA tariffs, prompting President Trump to announce plans to use Section 122 for a 10% across-the-board tariff on all imports and launch Section 301 investigations. Markets remain apprehensive about further details and potential exemptions.

items.title: ASML's High-NA EUV Technology Attracts Major Semiconductor Players
items.summary: Intel, Samsung, SK hynix, and TSMC are positioning themselves for ASML's High-NA EUV technology expected in 2027-28, signaling major investments in next-generation chip manufacturing capabilities.

items.title: Broadcom Introduces Industry's First 6G Digital Front-End SoC
items.summary: Broadcom has unveiled the industry's first 6G Digital Front-End System-on-Chip for Massive MIMO applications, advancing next-generation wireless technology infrastructure.

items.title: Samsung Faces Exynos Chip Cost Challenges Ahead of Galaxy S26 Launch
items.summary: Samsung cannot purchase its own Exynos chips at lower costs than competitors, contributing to anticipated price increases for the Galaxy S26 smartphone.

items.title: Zero Point Cryogenics Secures $5 Million for Quantum Computing Infrastructure
items.summary: Zero Point Cryogenics received $5 million in funding to advance commercialization of dilution refrigerators and cryogenics technology for defense prototyping and mission-critical applications.
